answers.answer: Tingling in the feet can be a neuropathy possibly caused by diabetes. Have you had your blood sugar checked? If you are a women and are near peri-menopause or menopause you can get cold and hot or just cold. But if not I was always cold in my 20's. Hormones can do this and probably a lot of things. Maybe thyroid. Have you had your TSH checked? Other hormones may regulate temperature.

question: What cause chills wirhout fever and tingling in the feetThis discussion is related to/posts/Family-Health/Chills/show/227683.
title: Chills
